intro: Androsace helvetica, commonly known as the Swiss wintergreen, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in a fine layer of white, woolly hair. Androsace helvetica thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes.
